issue.title: Phase change patch 5: Adding the actual phase change module/code. Examples and tests not included yet.
issue.body:
<!--
This template should be included in all pull requests. Items in the list should
either be completed by the original author or explicitly dismissed by one of the
IBAMR principal developers.

IBAMR is a community effort and it wouldn't exist without people contributing
code. Thanks in advance for helping to make IBAMR better!
-->

### IBAMR Pull Request Checklist
- [ ] Does the test suite pass?
- [ ] Was clang-format run?
- [ ] Were relevant issues cited? Please remember to add `Fixes #12345` to close
      the issue automatically if we are fixing the problem.
- [ ] Is this a change others will want to know about? If so, then has a
      changelog entry been added?
- [ ] If new data structures have been added to a class then have they been set
      up appropriately for restarts? If so, ensure that the restart version
      number is incremented.
- [ ] Does this change include a bug fix or new functionality? If so, a new test
      or tests should be added. New tests should run quickly (less than a minute
      in release mode). If possible, an older test should gain a new option so
      that we do not need to compile more test executables.
- [ ] Did you (if your account has permission to do so) set relevant labels on
      GitHub for the pull request?

comment.body: @drwells : Let's get this branch merged soon. Would you have time to  review this patch?

commits.message: Register h var in phase change examples which uses EnthalpyHI

payload.description: An adaptive and distributed-memory parallel implementation of the immersed boundary (IB) method

commits.message: Port travis doxygen workflow to GitHub actions.
Work off of a separate branch from master for now.

Merge pull request #1649 from drwells/doxygen-resurrection

Doxygen resurrection

pull_request.title: Doxygen resurrection
pull_request.body:
Part of the ongoing project to improve our documentation - lets get doxygen building again.

This PR just copies and pastes the travis build steps into a GitHub action. If that much works then we can start cleaning this up.

pull_request.title: Doxygen resurrection
pull_request.body:
Part of the ongoing project to improve our documentation - lets get doxygen building again.

This PR just copies and pastes the travis build steps into a GitHub action. If that much works then we can start cleaning this up.

repo.name: IBAMR
repo.description: An adaptive and distributed-memory parallel implementation of the immersed boundary (IB) method

repo.name: IBAMR
repo.description: An adaptive and distributed-memory parallel implementation of the immersed boundary (IB) method

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,48 @@
+## ---------------------------------------------------------------------
+##
+## Copyright (c) 2023 - 2023 by the IBAMR developers
+## All rights reserved.
+##
+## This file is part of IBAMR.
+##
+## IBAMR is free software and is distributed under the 3-clause BSD
+## license. The full text of the license can be found in the file
+## COPYRIGHT at the top level directory of IBAMR.
+##
+## ---------------------------------------------------------------------
+
+name: push
+on:
+  # things to do when we push to master
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - documentation-test-branch
+
+jobs:
+  deploy_documentation:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    name: Build IBAMR and run tests
+    env:
+      # TODO: this is a copy-and-paste of the Travis version. Once this is
+      # working we should clean it up.
+      TRAVIS_BUILD_NUMBER: ${{ github.run_number }}
+      TRAVIS_COMMIT: ${{ github.sha }}
+      DOXYFILE: ${{ github.workspace }}/doc/Doxyfile
+      GH_REPO_NAME: IBAMR
+      GH_REPO_REF: github.com/IBAMR/IBAMR.git
+      DOCS_REPO_REF: github.com/IBAMR/IBAMR-Docs
+      GH_REPO_TOKEN: ${{ github.token }}
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout Source
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        id: git
+      - name: Install dependencies
+        id: dependencies
+        run: |
+          sudo apt update && sudo apt install doxygen doxygen-gui doxygen-doc doxygen-latex graphviz
+          doxygen --version
+      - name: Run doxygen
+        id: doxygen
+        run: |
+          chmod +x generateDocumentationAndDeploy.sh
+          ./generateDocumentationAndDeploy.sh
comment.body: This works by updating the IBAMR/IBAMR-docs repository, which in turn is read by ibamr.github.io to populate the manual.

issue.title: The draft, and actually writing some tutorial programs
issue.body:
We need to make it easier for new people to get started with IBAMR. A good way to do this is to have a curated set of tutorial programs with inlined explanations of what is going on in the doxygen documentation.

I'm drafting all eligible (i.e., not presently writing their thesis) graduate students and postdocs using IBAMR here at UNC to help me in this task - they will do most of the tutorial writing. The first thing to do here is to resurrect the doxygen deployment scripts which have been offline for quite some time - see #1649.

+## COPYRIGHT at the top level directory of IBAMR.
+##
+## ---------------------------------------------------------------------

+  # things to do when we push to master
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - documentation-test-branch
comment.body: There's no good way to test this without first merging this branch so that GitHub actions start to run. For now, we'll run these steps (which might fail - I don't know what the state of the Travis instructions were) whenever this (non-master) branch is updated and once things are set up we'll switch this to 'master'.

commits.message: Changes regarding loop over hierarchy inside setDataOnPatch on examples/phase_change
Changes regarding loop over hierarchy inside setDataOnPatch

issue.title: Marker data weird behavior with restarts
issue.body: I was testing restarts with `ex4`, and if I ran past the start of the markers, quit the simulation, and then restarted the markers, everything would look fine until I tried to call `time_integrator->setMarkers({})`, at that time I would get the error stated in IBAMR/four-chambered-heart#199 . [Here](https://github.com/marshallrdavey/IBAMR/tree/davey/marker-stuff) is a branch from my local fork that has the hacky changes to the example included. I would run to ~50 time steps, and then restart. The branch is fine if you don't restart, which is the weird part. I would just change the `END_TIME = 110*DT` in the input file to not run to 10000.

pull_request.title: conditionally configure contributed boost & fix boost for C++17 compilers
pull_request.body:
<!--
This template should be included in all pull requests. Items in the list should
either be completed by the original author or explicitly dismissed by one of the
IBAMR principal developers.

IBAMR is a community effort and it wouldn't exist without people contributing
code. Thanks in advance for helping to make IBAMR better!
-->

### IBAMR Pull Request Checklist
- [ ] Does the test suite pass?
- [ ] Was clang-format run?
- [ ] Were relevant issues cited? Please remember to add `Fixes #12345` to close
      the issue automatically if we are fixing the problem.
- [ ] Is this a change others will want to know about? If so, then has a
      changelog entry been added?
- [ ] If new data structures have been added to a class then have they been set
      up appropriately for restarts? If so, ensure that the restart version
      number is incremented.
- [ ] Does this change include a bug fix or new functionality? If so, a new test
      or tests should be added. New tests should run quickly (less than a minute
      in release mode). If possible, an older test should gain a new option so
      that we do not need to compile more test executables.
- [ ] Did you (if your account has permission to do so) set relevant labels on
      GitHub for the pull request?

@@ -94,7 +94,9 @@ dnl provided by argument)
 CONFIGURE_LIBMESH
 CONFIGURE_PETSC
 # Configure other libraries that are not themselves dependencies:
-CONFIGURE_BOOST("$ABSOLUTE_SRCDIR/contrib/boost","\$(abs_top_builddir)/contrib/boost")
+if test "$USING_BUNDLED_BOOST" = yes; then
+  CONFIGURE_BOOST("$ABSOLUTE_SRCDIR/contrib/boost","\$(abs_top_builddir)/contrib/boost")
+fi
